post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
Hi, this afternoon, my ACER AL2416w 24' widescreen died.
Look like an implosion in smoke! ...i never saw that.
It was only one and an half years old, and i don't know what caused that.

I suppose it's a rare thing, but it's a real shame a thing like that happen, on a so expensive material, so short after the guarantee expired.

post.author: Douglas Quaid
post.body: Make sure that the plug is connected to the socket and the switch is turned on!

post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
Douglas Quaid wrote:
Make sure that the plug is connected to the socket and the switch is turned on!

post.author: bashport
post.body:
6th Venom wrote:
Look like an implosion in smoke! ...i never saw that.



I once saw that happen with a television... the sound of it was quite impressive.
you must be strong now. Its hard when something passes away in that tragically manner

I can recommend dell, when you're ready to move on

post.author: 6th Venom
post.body:
bashport wrote:
I can recommend dell, when you're ready to move on

I already bought a SAMSUNG SyncMaster 2223w in the same afternoon (the first real screen i found near home),
i can't live without my pc... am i sick doctor?

post.author: The Happy Friar
post.body: I have 3 monitors now. Duel screens + a backup. I'd find someone getting rid of a space 15" or so, just so you have a backup, just in case. It's hard to replace them sometimes, I know. Been there.

post.author: bashport
post.body:
The Happy Friar wrote:
I have 3 monitors now. Duel screens + a backup. I'd find someone getting rid of a space 15" or so, just so you have a backup, just in case. It's hard to replace them sometimes, I know. Been there.



lets make a 'show your workspace' thread out of it.
I'm gonna start and so I have won already!


(who can locate The Happy Friar in the picture?)
